meanings.definition: Exhausted of vigor or energy; worn out
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, the effete hiker could barely lift his backpack.
meanings.sent2: The old car's engine was so effete that it struggled to climb steep hills.
meanings.sent3: The effete phone battery gave up just as the important call was about to connect.
meanings.sent4: The effete candle flickered weakly before extinguishing in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The effete flower wilted in the scorching sun, lacking the strength to bloom fully.

meanings.sent1: The effete kitten struggled to climb onto the high shelf.
meanings.sent2: The effete plant wilted under the harsh sunlight in the desert.
meanings.sent3: The effete balloon lost air slowly, unable to stay afloat for long.
meanings.sent4: Her effete voice barely carried across the noisy room.
meanings.sent5: The effete athlete could not keep up with the rest of the team during practice.

meanings.sent1: The effete empire crumbled under the weight of its own corruption.
meanings.sent2: The effete aristocrat spent his days in luxury, oblivious to the struggles of the common people.
meanings.sent3: The effete party guests nibbled on tiny, tasteless appetizers.
meanings.sent4: The effete society was too fragile to withstand any form of hardship.
meanings.sent5: The effete painting lacked the boldness and passion of the artist's earlier works.
